title: Assistant Bookkeeper
description:
**Title:** Assistant Bookkeeper ‘B’ Grade 8 (OPEIU L153)

**Rate of Pay:** $67,780.57 (Weekly: $1,203.76 + $99.71 FICA Reimbursement)

**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt

**Employer:** Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry

**Department**: Accounting

**Location:** 158-11 Harry Van Arsdale Jr Ave, Fresh Meadows, NY 11365

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

Reporting to the Manager of Accounting, under close supervision, the Assistant Bookkeeper ‘B’ will be responsible for but not limited to:

* Process Split-Off reports (journal and transfer funds to various accounts)
* Reconcile benefit contributions yearly with IT department for external auditors
* Process EESISP wrap and Contractor Refund
* Maintain monthly contribution schedule for various funds
* Maintain Target Fund withdrawals/ check writing
* Set up stipulations
* Process no monies payroll
* Process Benefit Replacement checks write off
* Print Benefit Replacement checks weekly
* Print Accounts Payable checks weekly
* Upload journals into the accounting software
* Process voids and reissues for multiple funds
* Will serve as a back-up on other functions in the department as necessary
* Handle special projects as assigned by the Accounting Manager

**Work Environment** 

We thrive to provide a supportive and collaborative environment. We are employee- focused emphasizing mutual respect a strong sense of community and a positive team culture. We offer a healthy work -life balances and a desirable work environment with a diverse workforce.

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, using computer/keyboard/typing, phone use, open/close filing cabinets as necessary.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time onsite 35 hours per week– Non-Exempt (OPEIU Local 153) position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday 8:30AM-4:30PM.

**Flexibility:** Must be able to work overtime when necessary.

**Travel:** No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* A Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance
* Minimum of three years of experience in accounting required
* Must have academic and practical accounting background
* Must have excellent analytical, verbal and written skills
* Must have the ability to multi-task
* Must demonstrate attention to detail
* Ability to work professionally and cooperatively with others
* Highly proficient in excel and word in an accounting environment

**HIPAA COMPLIANCE REQUIRED**

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**BENEFITS**

* 10% of employer contribution to your 401K (before FICA gross-up reimbursement) *without* mandatory matching, vested immediately before.
* Basic Pay + FICA reimbursement (Social Security and Medicare Tax reimbursed as weekly added to compensation) = total weekly compensation.
* After completing 26 weeks of full-time employment from permanent hire date: Free health, dental, and optical insurance - funded by the employer, NO employee premium. Coverage thru Magna Care PPO (Medical), Express Script for Prescription, and DDS/Empire Dental. In addition, eligible employees may use JIB Medical P.C.
* Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability.
* NYS Paid Family Leave.
* Jury Duty and Death in family bereavement days off.
* 11 Paid Holidays
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Vacation
* Retirement plan – Defined Pension Plan with vesting and age requirement, fully funded by employer.
* Life Insurance.

**Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,780.57 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Physical Setting:

* Office

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Accounting: 3 years (Required)
* Multitasking: 1 year (Required)
* Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Fresh Meadows, NY 11365 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Fleet Lead
description:
Fleet Lead
NEW YORK, NY / FACILITIES /FULL-TIME

Position: Fleet Leader
Reports to: Facilities Director
Compensation: $78,800 - $97,000
Status: Full-time non-exempt position
Union: Union position
Anticipated Start Date: September 2024
Location: Hybrid/Harlem NYC-Based - Mink Building
Travel Requirements: Up to 20 days per year outside the NYC Metro area, including overnight travel. **Summary**
BioBus is seeking a dedicated and experienced Fleet Leader to oversee the recruitment, training, scheduling, and management of our driver team. The Fleet Leader will ensure the safe and efficient transportation of our mobile science labs, microscopes, and other scientific equipment throughout the NYC Metro area. This role requires a strong commitment to safety, compliance, and customer service, as well as excellent organizational and leadership skills. The Fleet Leader position is an excellent opportunity for someone with experience in leading roles within a facilities department who wants to develop team management skills.

**Company Information**
BioBus helps K-12 and college students discover, explore, and pursue science. We focus on students excluded from the scientific community due to factors such as race, gender, economic status, and physical access. Through this work, we envision a world where all people have the opportunity to reach their full scientific potential. We’ve reached 350,000 students at more than 900 schools since 2008, primarily in NYC public and charter schools, as far away as California and more recently we have expanded to the Boston area with a team based in New England.

BioBus students connect with scientists from diverse backgrounds, learn lab and research skills, practice science communication, and take steps to become the next generation of scientists and problem-solvers, making the world better for all of us. Our students access and become part of the scientific community through introductory science labs aboard our mobile labs at their schools; after-school, weekend, and summer programs; and year-long internships. Our recent expansion in the Bronx is poised to provide a full pathway of programs for students in the Bronx.

BioBus encourages creativity and creates space for all staff to suggest new programs, new methods, and otherwise have a voice in shaping the direction of their team and the organization. We offer a casual work environment, flexible and hybrid work schedules including up to two - three days a week working from home, competitive benefits, and a friendly and supportive culture free from excessive hierarchy.
**Requirements*** Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in logistics, transportation, business administration, or a related field preferred.
* At least 4+ years of experience in fleet management, logistics, or transportation.
* Valid Class A or Class B CDL with a clean driving record.
* Extensive experience operating commercial vehicles in NYC or other dense urban environments.
* Strong knowledge of federal and state transportation regulations.
* Excellent organizational, communication, collaboration, and leadership skills.
* Democratic approach to work in collaboration with fellow facilities team members.
* Ability to perform basic vehicle and lab equipment maintenance tasks.
* Self-motivated with the ability to independently structure and manage time effectively.
* Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
* Proficient in GPS navigation systems, route planning software, fleet management software, and cloud-based collaborative documents and spreadsheets (e.g., google workspace, Office 365).
* Physical fitness and the ability to lift and move heavy cargo, up to 50 lbs, as needed.
* Willingness to work flexible hours, including weekends, and adapt to changing schedules.
* Willingness to travel locally for programs across the NYC Metro area, including the five boroughs with occasional local travel to neighboring New Jersey, Connecticut, Long Island and Westchester counties, up to 1-2 days per week.
* Willingness to travel up to 20 days per year outside the NYC Metro area, including overnight travel.
* Bilingual in English and Spanish preferred.

 **Responsibilities** **Driver Recruitment and Training:*** Support Director to recruit, hire, and onboard qualified drivers who embody our company values and standards.
* Develop and conduct comprehensive training programs to ensure drivers are equipped with the necessary skills and knowledge, in collaboration with all facilities team members.

 **Scheduling and Dispatch:*** Efficiently schedule drivers for routes and special events while optimizing resources and minimizing downtime.
* Coordinate vehicle logistics, including parking logistics, with program site contacts to ensure safe, efficient, and timely departures and arrivals.

 **Safety and Compliance:*** Uphold strict adherence to all safety regulations and compliance standards.
* Conduct regular safety inspections of vehicles and ensure drivers are fully compliant with all relevant regulations and protocols.

 **Customer Service:*** Collaborate with the program operations team to address any driver-related program disruptions promptly and effectively.
* Maintain a customer-centric approach to driver operations, ensuring the highest level of satisfaction for our students and partners.

 **Fleet Management:*** Coordinate with other facilities team members and outside contractors to ensure all vehicles are properly maintained and serviced according to schedule.
* Oversee vehicle inspections and repairs, minimizing downtime and maximizing fleet efficiency.
* Ability to perform basic vehicle and lab equipment maintenance tasks.

 **Budget and Process Management:*** Assist in the development and management of the fleet operations budget, ensuring resources are allocated efficiently and cost-effectively.
* Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement best practices to enhance driver performance, efficiency, and customer satisfaction.

 **Commercial Driving*** Experience operating commercial vehicles in NYC or other urban environment
* Ability to operate BioBus Mobile Science labs approximately 2-4x per month and be an on call backup for other drivers as needed.
* Occasional (approx. 2x per month) evening or weekend work.


The salary range for this position is $78,800 - $97,000. If hired for this position, your salary offer will include compensation calculated based on years of relevant experience, degrees, or a class A commercial drivers license .  

Compensation at BioBus is competitive, commensurate with experience, and is in alignment with internal equity. BioBus regularly conducts a thorough study of market-competitive salaries. Our goal is to ensure that pay is fair and competitive for all staff members, both considering the market and considering pay equity among staff in similar roles in the organization. In addition, BioBus offers a very generous health benefits package, Flexible Spending Accounts for medical, childcare and commuter expenses, and an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) as well as retirement benefits with employer match. Benefits preview available here. Additionally, BioBus offers generous time off with pay in order to support a sustainable high performance work culture. Full-time union staff receive 25 vacation days per year, along with time off for up to 16 holidays, five personal days, and 15 sick days. We also offer a paid sabbatical for full time staff after seven years of service.
This position is included in a union-represented collective bargaining unit, and specific terms and conditions of employment are subject to collective bargaining negotiations.**An Equal-Opportunity Employer with a Commitment to Diversity**
BioBus seeks to fill this position with someone who shares our values, including our organizational commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, marital status, military status, pregnancy, or parenthood. Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every single one of the qualifications as described in a job description. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive organization and we are most interested in finding the BEST candidate for the job. That candidate may be one who comes from a less traditional background, and that’s okay. We would strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the qualifications described.

title: Director, Medical Safety Assessment Physician
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.  

  

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**Director, Medical Safety Assessment Physician (Immunology)**  

  

**Functional Area Description**  

  

The Worldwide Patient Safety (WWPS) group is responsible for ensuring the safety of our medicines. WWPS pharmacovigilance and pharmacoepidemiology deliverables include single case and aggregate safety monitoring, safety reporting, contributing to benefit-risk assessment, risk management planning and strategy, execution of certain postmarketing commitments, and ensuring compliance with global regulatory requirements.  

  

**Position Summary**  

  

* Lead safety activities and benefit-risk strategies for assigned BMS compounds/programs in the Immunology Therapeutic Area (TA) and chair the product Safety Management Team(s).

  

* Oversee, prepare, and/or review aggregate safety review documents as well as safety sections of relevant clinical trial documents and regulatory filings.

  

* Lead team in the evaluation & management of signals emerging from any data source. Develop strategy for signal evaluation and document outcome.

  

* Lead safety labeling activities for assigned products/program. Act as the Safety Subject Matter Expert for input to regulatory product labeling. Participate/provide input at cross-functional labeling team meetings and provide regional safety labeling support.

  

* Lead process improvement projects. Assist the Medical Safety Assessment (MSA) TA Head/Lead in developing and maintaining state-of-the-art Pharmacovigilance (PV) processes and procedures within BMS Drug Development and WWPS.

  

* Support the EU Qualified Person for PV or other regional or local Qualified Person for PV relative to issues relating to assigned products.

  

* Provide input to Drug Development publication strategy/plan & ensure safety input to publications/presentations.

  

* Actively drive safety strategy preparation and represent WWPS at Health Authority (HA) and Data Monitoring Committee (DMC) meetings.

  

* Ensure that the above tasks are performed in the most efficient manner possible commensurate with quality, accuracy, and timeliness and in accordance with current global regulatory requirements and BMS cost effectiveness goals.

  

* Promote collegiality and teamwork among peers. Mentor/support colleagues as a positive change agent.

  

**Position Responsibilities**  

  

**General Product Support**  

  

* Lead safety activities and benefit-risk strategies for assigned BMS compounds and chair the product SMT(s).

  

* Oversee, prepare, and/or review aggregate safety review documents (eg, Development Safety Update Reports [DSUR], Periodic Benefit-Risk Evaluation Reports [PBRER]) and safety sections of relevant clinical trial documents (eg, protocols, clinical study reports [CSR], investigator brochures [IB], informed consent forms [ICF]) and regulatory filings (eg, clinical trial applications, marketing authorization applications).

  

* Lead team in evaluation & management of signals emerging from any data source. Develop strategy for signal evaluation (eg, case-series, literature review, HA/ claims database). Document by Safety Topic Review/ Signal Report or other means of communication.

  

* Lead safety labeling activities for assigned products. Act as the Safety Subject Matter Expert for input to regulatory product labeling. Participate/provide input at cross-functional labeling team meetings and provide regional safety labeling support.

  

* Support the EU QPPV or other regional or local Qualified Person for PV relative to issues relating to assigned products.

  

* Provide input to Drug Development publication strategy/plan & ensure safety input to publications/presentations.

  

**Clinical Development**  

  

* Act as the global safety lead for assigned compounds in development. Provide safety lead support for global submission document production. Review draft summary documents.

  

* Lead medical safety development and execution of benefit-risk management strategies for assigned products.

  

* Provide safety input to clinical development plans, study protocols, amendments, IB, statistical analysis plan, ICF, CSR, responses to HA or institutional review board/ ethics committee queries.

  

* Lead development of safety risk language, risk management strategy, pre-filing safety activities including safety table shells, integrated safety data review, integrated safety summary document review, and safety-focused publication development.

  

* Perform medical safety review of DSUR, annual reports and other periodic safety submissions.

  

* Support safety strategy preparation for pre-submission meetings, Advisory Committee meetings, Scientific Advice meetings, DMC meetings, etc.

  

**Postmarketing Support**  

  

* Act as the safety lead for assigned marketed compounds and support global postmarketing safety activities and submissions.

  

* Provide medical safety, benefit-risk input for safety aggregate reports, product renewal submissions, postmarketing study documents and reports, responses to HA queries.

  

* Lead medical safety oversight of and execution of risk management strategies and RMP elements for assigned products.

  

* Lead safety signal evaluation & management. Prepare and review reports on safety signals (ie, Safety Topic Reviews/Signal Reports) and ad hoc regulatory responses.

  

* Provide postmarketing safety study guidance to other groups including epidemiology and medical affairs including but not limited to investigator-sponsored research, epidemiology studies, and non-interventional safety studies.

  

* Ensure safety labeling adequately reflects emerging postmarketing safety profile.

  

**Department Activities**  

  

* Lead process improvement projects. Assist the MSA TA Head/Lead in developing and maintaining state-of-the-art PV processes and procedures within BMS Drug Development and WWPS.

  

* Support preparation for regulatory inspections with evaluation of current processes and assess alignment with regulatory expectations, guidelines, and mandates.

  

* Assist the team and senior management in all forms of issue management and crisis management.

  

* Liaise with all TA staff and maintain an effective and collaborative patient safety team.

  

* Support hiring & orientation.

  

**Cross-Functional Activities**  

  

* Provide input to strategic plans for safety differentiation of BMS products.

  

* Prepare and provide training to BMS employees on product safety profiles/issues.

  

* Act as WWPS liaison for assigned products with BMS functions (Legal, Business Development, Operations, Marketing, etc.).

  

* Support manufacturing quality. Co-Author integrated health hazard assessments.

  

* Develop communications of safety data & interpretation to BMS and external parties, globally.

  

**Degree Requirements**  

  

MD/equivalent required. Postgraduate qualification or experience in internal medicine, immunology, or related specialty desirable.  

  

**Experience Requirements**  

  

3+ years in PV or relevant pharmaceutical or biomedical field (eg, Medical, Clinical, Regulatory) is strongly preferred. Other relevant experiences & accomplishments considered, such as roles in clinical research, observational research & clinical practice experience.  

  

**Key Competency Requirements**  

  

* Understanding of the drug development process.

  

* Knowledge of PV and ability to apply knowledge to evaluation of safety concerns and minimization of patient risk throughout the life cycle of a drug product.

  

* Proficient ability to leverage the range of available tools to investigate safety concerns, including the science of observational research.

  

* Understanding of regulatory requirements for safety assessment and action.

  

* Strong scientific analytical reasoning skills.

  

* Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel.

  

* Excellent attention to detail.

  

* Behavioral competencies necessary to work and lead within a complex matrix environment.

  

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  

If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn't perfectly line up with your resume, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career.
  

  

**Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers**  

With a single vision as inspiring as Transforming patients' lives through science™ , every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  

  

**On-site Protocol**  

  

BMS has a diverse occupancy structure that determines where an employee is required to conduct their work. This structure includes site-essential, site-by-design, field-based and remote-by-design jobs. The occupancy type that you are assigned is determined by the nature and responsibilities of your role:
  

  

Site-essential roles require 100% of shifts onsite at your assigned facility. Site-by-design roles may be eligible for a hybrid work model with at least 50% onsite at your assigned facility. For these roles, onsite presence is considered an essential job function and is critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, and a positive Company culture. For field-based and remote-by-design roles the ability to physically travel to visit customers, patients or business partners and to attend meetings on behalf of BMS as directed is an essential job function.
  

  

BMS is dedicated to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace accommodations/adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request a reasonable workplace accommodation/adjustment prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodations/adjustments in completing this application, or in any part of the recruitment process, direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com . Visit careers.bms.com/ eeo -accessibility to access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement.
  

  

BMS cares about your well-being and the well-being of our staff, customers, patients, and communities. As a result, the Company strongly recommends that all employees be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and keep up to date with Covid-19 boosters.
  

  

BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area.  

  

Any data processed in connection with role applications will be treated in accordance with applicable data privacy policies and regulations.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
We have our eyes set on one goal, to create the best consumer experience and enhance customer satisfaction. If you love assisting others, you’re empathetic, an exceptional active listener, and good at addressing customer inquiries regarding company products and services and their account and billing issues, then your job search ends here. Our Customer Service Representatives enjoy positively resolving matters while keeping company interests in mind. Our mission is to offer the best customer support possible while providing a substantial career opportunity for our Customer Service Representative team.

Our Customer Service Representative team is tenacious, courteous, and, most importantly, eager to make this year our best year yet! We've assembled a loyal team of Customer Service Representatives who are empowered to make decisions and inspired to go the extra mile for the client. Enjoy a career enriched with opportunities where you will continuously develop your professional knowledge while being a part of our diverse and inclusive environment.

**Customer Service Representative Responsibilities:**

* Pinpoint and assess customer concerns by actively listening to their desired needs and providing a solution in an applicable time
* Communicate professionally, openly, and persuasively with customers to portray the value and benefits of our client’s services, sales promotions, and products
* Work efficiently with fellow Customer Service Representatives and Sales team members to meet or exceed customer acquisition and sales goals
* Maintain updated customer information at all times, including account information, billing, contact information, and updated address
* Follow all standards and company policies while interacting with customers, clients, staff members, and the management team
* Identify opportunities for improvement and contribute new ideas during staff meetings to upper management for discussion and implementation

**Customer Service Representative Qualifications:**

* A high school diploma or GED is a must
* 0-3 years of customer service, retail, sales, or client relations experience is highly desirable
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-volume environment, meeting customer demands in a safe, accurate, and timely manner
* Provide exceptional customer service at all times
* Excellent active listening, interpersonal, and communication skills
* Be a team player, assisting coworkers whenever needed
* A self-motivated and determined individual with a desire to succeed

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $800.00 - $1,250.00 per week

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Work Location: On the road

Under general supervision of a Teacher, is responsible for assisting him/her in the conduct of classes and activities and provides personal care to the children.

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
Pet Pantry Warehouse is seeking a new Retail Sales Associate for our Larchmont NY team! This is a part time position ranging from 15-30 hours per week, with potential to increase your hours into a full time benefits eligible position. Additional hours may be available if willing to work in our nearby NY locations in Rye and Scarsdale.

**Seasonal or high school applicants will not be considered for this position.** College students applying must be willing to continue employment after school sessions begin, even if part time only. High School students will not be considered due to their limited schedule availability on weekdays. Seasonal positions do not exist, as our training process is extensive and will not be completed before seasonal periods end.

You will be responsible for selling products, merchandise, and services in a retail setting in order to drive company revenue. Outgoing and energetic personalities who enjoy working with people and pets, and understand the environment of retail sales are a must!

Applicants must be comfortable and capable of driving a "sprinter" style van with a valid driver's license at the time of hire.

Opportunity exists for upward promotion within the company. Animal lovers are welcome and preferred!

**Responsibilities (including but not limited to):**

* Welcome and identify customer needs

* Investigate and resolve customer complaints

* Company Van Supply/Product Transfers

* Previous experience in sales, customer service, or other related fields
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to build rapport with customers
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to lift at least 50#
* Flexible schedule-ability to fill morning and evening shifts weekdays and weekends
* Open availability on Tuesday, Wednesday, and one (flexible) weekend days are required! Please do not apply if you have scheduling restrictions on these days.

Benefits:

* Paid Time Off (NY Sick Time)

Ohel Children's Home and Family Services is seeking dedicated and responsible staff to work with individuals who have developmental and/or intellectual disabilities living in supportive and loving residential settings in Brooklyn, Queens, Lower East Side, Far Rockaway and Long Island. title: Childrens Theraputic Recreation Assistant
description:
Ditmas Children’s Nursing & Rehab


**POSITION**: Therapeutic Recreation Assistant


**DESCRIPTION**: Ditmas Children's Nursing & Rehab is looking for an organized, compassionate, and highly engaged Therapeutic Recreation Assistant. In this role, the successful candidate is responsible for managing the delivery of developmentally appropriate play activities, expressive arts, and special events for pediatric patients and family. The Recreation Assistant maintains a safe, clean, and developmentally appropriate environment for both group and one-on-one activities.


**SCHEDULE: Part Time - Evening and weekend coverage required**


**Job Responsibilities:**

* Facilitates normalization and positive adjustment of pediatric patients to the facility experience by providing developmentally appropriate play opportunities.
* Facilitates and promotes patient participation in special events, holiday activities, etc.
* Managing behavior and environmental conditions to foster safety and infection control.
* Communicates and collaborates with members of the interdisciplinary team in a professional and effective manner.
* Maintains confidentiality per facility policy, communicates relevant patient information to supervisor and other members of the treatment team.
* Develops and demonstrates a therapeutic and supportive relationship with patients and families, maintaining appropriate professionalism and boundaries.
* Ensures the safety of patients and all participants during activities, special events, and programs, including transport to and from activities.
* Complies with all department, facility, and regulatory agency policies and procedures including emergency procedures, infection control, patient safety, and environmental safety.
* Maintains equipment and the working environment in a neat and orderly manner according to departmental procedures. Requests needed equipment and supplies on a timely basis.
* Participates in ongoing education and development to enhance skills and programming.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

 **Minimum Qualifications:** High School Diploma; A minimum two years of childcare experience; Associate degree in Therapeutic Recreation or Health Related Field preferred


**Preferred Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s Degree in child development, early childhood education/elementary education, or a related field preferred.

**STATUS:** Part Time


**LOCATION:** 2103 Ditmas Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11226, USA

title: Career & Workforce Specialist
company: Spring Creek Recreational Fund/ The Opportunity Hub
description:
**Career & Workforce Specialist**   
**Job Description**

**Reports to: Sr Director, Future-Focused Growth**  
**Hours and Schedule:** 35hours/week; Monday-Friday, some flexibility with daily schedule. Some weekend events required. This is a non-exempt position.  
**Location:** This position is in-person, working from Spring Creek Towers in East New York, Brooklyn.

**Summary/Description:**   
The Opportunity Hub (The Opp Hub) seeks a College Access and Success Advisor. The Opp Hub serves the 15,000+ residents of Spring Creek Towers in East New York, Brooklyn. The Opp Hub was re-launched in 2021 to ensure that all residents of the Spring Creek Towers community have access to the resources they need to succeed and thrive. We envision a community where all residents live in secure and quality housing, are healthy and well, and are empowered to pursue opportunity. Learn more about us at: www.theopphub.org.

We seek a Career and Workforce Specialist to provide career readiness and economic mobility programming as part of our Future-Focused Growth department. Strong candidates will be an exceptional team member with strong workforce development and engagement skills, with the ability to build and develop our economic mobility and job readiness programming. The ideal candidate is well versed in career counseling and preparation, a skilled facilitator, able to build rapport with community members, and build ongoing partnerships with potential training partners and employers. They will be looked to for leadership regarding the growth of our career development and financial literacy initiatives for adults, young adults, and youth, ensuring that our services are aligned with trends and policy changes in the field.

**Responsibilities:**

* Facilitate workshops on career readiness topics such as resume development, interviewing skills, job readiness, effective communication, and entrepreneurship.
* Provide 1-on-1 career advisement and readiness support for those who request additional assistance.
* Support job seekers and those seeking a career transition in identifying strengths and interests, exploring various career paths, and understanding any training and education requirements.
* Develop outreach initiatives to recruit participants.
* Partner with businesses, city agencies, and community-based organizations to develop a wide variety of employment opportunities, training opportunities, and coordinate onsite trainings.
* Create and maintain a strong job readiness environment aligned with the community we serve.
* Coordinate financial education and literacy services and build partnerships with financial institutions and organizations with expertise in this area.
* Take a leadership role in planning career and resource fairs on site and represent The Opp Hub at community events.
* Plan and facilitate career and college panels with the College Access & Success Advisor.
* Keep accurate and complete records of all programmatic activities, deliverables, and outcomes; use this data to inform service delivery.
* Other duties as required.

**Qualifications and Experience:**

* BA required, Masters’ degree in a relevant field preferred.
* 3+ years of experience working at a social services or educational organization; substantive experience with workforce development programming for adults, young adults, and youth.
* Considerable knowledge of job readiness, career counseling and program development.
* Skilled multi-tasker, able to organize, manage and evaluate multiple activities and services.
* Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with staff, volunteers, and community members.
* Communicate clearly and compassionately, taking into account diverse opinions, values, and cultures.
* Ability to track and report on data is essential.
* Bilingual candidates encouraged to apply.

**Salary and Benefits:**

Salary range for this position is between $55,000-$60,000 and is commensurate with experience. The Opportunity Hub offers comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, life, and long- term disability insurance; a 401(K) retirement plan with employer match; Employee Wellness

Program; commuter benefits; and voluntary supplemental insurance

**Apply:**

Interested and qualified individuals should forward their resumes with cover letter to: info@theopphub.org with the subject “Career & Workforce Specialist."

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Social or Educational Services: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: ADMINISTRATOR/EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT
description:
Children of the City (COTC) is a community-based organization that has been serving disadvantaged children and families since 1981. Our mission is to reach at-risk inner-city children with hope, guidance, and resources to positively impact their lives and communities, breaking the cycle of poverty and its effects through education and outreach. COC runs several programs including an afterschool and summer program, college bound programs, food distribution, parent workshops and monthly community events.

Children of the City is seeking to hire a Full or Part-time Administrator. The ideal candidate is a critical member of the administrative and management team at Children of the City, reporting to the Executive Director and Director of Operations. The Administrator will collaborate closely with the Upper Management and liaise administratively with the Children of the City’s staff and partners.

This position requires a confident, efficient, highly organized self-starter with good people skills, exceptional project management skills, detail oriented, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Among the key responsibilities of the Administrator are direct management of office affairs administration, daily office and facilities management, keeping yearly calendar, and other tasks assigned by the Executive Director.

**Required Skills**

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Excellent interpersonal negotiation and conflict-resolution skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to prioritize tasks.
* Professionalism, integrity, and confidentiality are essential.
* Proficiency with software technology is a key requirement. The position involves notably the use of MS Word, Excel, Google Workspace apps, Google Suite, Zoom, and Calendar.

**Job Description**

· Candidate will work alongside the Executive Director and staff, maintaining schedules, time and task, communications, and whatever is needed for administration and operations.

· Candidate will be expected to keep a time and task yearly calendar, working alongside Program staff and Upper management to ensure all operations of the organizations are being carried out in a timely fashion and to ensure that all documentation needed for outcomes and contracts are being maintained.

· Candidate will be expected to maintain accurate information and time and task management to organizational functions, programs, fundraising and new development keeping neat and organized system of departmental filing on the server as well as hard copies, maintaining a neat, organized and conducive office environment.

· Candidate will document, follow up and ensure tasks that arise from staff meetings, partnership endeavors or otherwise are carried out in a timely fashion and ensure basic communications with vendors, contractual partners, donors, program partners and participants, and board members.

· Candidate will function in a small support role to our finance manager, conducting any necessary record keeping.

· Candidate will work with program and project staff, providing management, support and oversight to all functions, including database input, tracking, outcome reporting, and participant and volunteer recruitment,

Position is fulltime but open to parttime with option to increase to full time, depending on candidate. Salary starts between $18 and $28 per hour, negotiable based on skill and experience with opportunity for advancement within the organization.

Bilingual (English/Spanish) is a plus.

Knowledge of SACC Department of Health licensing is a plus.

Children of the City (COC) operates through multiple partnerships, volunteers and faith-based organizations.

For further information and inquiry, please submit a resume to office@childrenofthecity.org

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $28.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner
description:
We believe in the power of people to create great care and we are inviting the best healthcare professionals to build their career with us!

  


* Join a collegial team of primary and specialty care professionals
* Flexible Schedules for Maximum Work-Life Balance
* Financial Stability with no Billing or Overhead Responsibility
* New graduates and experienced candidates encouraged to apply

  




A multidisciplinary community health center in Spring Valley, NY, seeks a Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner to join our Behavioral Health team. The Psychiatric NP will provide behavioral health treatment for a wide-variety psychiatric disorders and help with all aspects of patient care including diagnosis, treatment, collaboration and consultations.


**Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner Responsibilities**:


* Assesses the patient’s general mental health condition by collecting medical histories, administering comprehensive psychiatric evaluations and identifying issues that may be affecting the patient’s state of mental health.
* Interprets and integrates data to determine preliminary diagnosis and creates an individualized therapeutic plan for mental health problems and psychiatric disorders based on evidence-based standards of care and practice guidelines.
* Prescribes psychotropic drugs and related medications to treat symptoms of psychiatric disorders and improve functional health status based on clinical indications of a patient’s status, including results of diagnostic and lab tests.
* Identifies, measures, and monitors clinical and related behavioral outcomes to determine the effectiveness and appropriateness of the plan of care.
* Educates patients and /or family as to the nature of the psychiatric condition and provides appropriate instructions on proper intervention and treatment.
* Collaborates with the psychiatrists and other staff members in the team in managing acute and long-term medical and psychiatric/mental health needs of patients.
* Documents medical history and treatment plans effectively, concisely and accurately. Maintains patient confidentiality.
* Coordinates referrals and ongoing access to primary and other health care services for patients.
* Provides consultation to and seeks consultation from other health care clinicians to enhance quality and continuity of care.
* Collaborates with other departments in the health center to improve and enhance communication and quality of care.
* Provides coverage for other providers after hours or when away (e.g. vacations or time off).
* Complies with applicable policies and procedures and supports the Compliance Program.
* Contributes to organizational operations by performing other duties as may be required .

  


**Benefits:**
* **3500.00 Sign on bonus for full time.**
* **Competitive Compensation:** Enjoy the security of financial stability with no billing or overhead responsibility.
* **Our facilities are eligible for NHSC loan repayment and NYS Public Loan Forgiveness to help manage your financial burden.**
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** We provide full benefits, including life, health, dental, and vision coverage, ensuring your well-being.
* **Paid Malpractice Insurance:** FTCA Malpractice Coverage
* **Financial Planning:** Benefit from our 403B plan, ensuring your financial security for the future.
* **Tax Advantages:** Flexible Spending Accounts and Health Reimbursement Cards
* **Professional Growth:** Support for CME activities and medical licensure ensures you stay at the forefront of your field.
* **Work-Life Balance:** Enjoy generous PTO accruals and up to 13 Paid Holidays.

**Live, Work and Play in Rockland:**


* Situated along the majestic Hudson River
* Easy drive to New York City and airports
* Scenic waterfront villages
* Mountain vistas and parks; hiking and biking trails
* Prestigious schools and universities
* Vibrant health, retail, manufacturing, pharmaceutical and construction industries

**Apply Today:**



If you're a dedicated Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner looking to make a positive impact, we invite you to apply.

  



Apply now to be a part of our dynamic medical team.


* BSN, MSN preferred; successful completion of an approved nurse practitioner psychiatric program
* Current registered nurse license and certification in New York State
* Minimum of three years of professional nursing experience in a clinic or hospital setting plus at least one year of psychiatric nurse practitioner experience
* Knowledge of professional nursing theory, practices and regulations to give and evaluate patient care
* Knowledge of drug regimens and their indications, dosing, side effects, and proper administration
* Knowledge of current and emerging trends in technologies, techniques, methods, issues and approaches in psychiatry
* Knowledge of state and federal rules and regulations as they apply to the advanced practice of nursing
* Displays exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to react calmly and effectively in emergency situations
* Ability to establish/maintain effective working relationships with patients, families, and other members of the health care team

title: Dietary Aides LTC Facility
description:
A Dietary Aide, plays a crucial role in ensuring that patients in healthcare facilities maintain a healthy diet. Here are the primary responsibilities of a Dietary Aide:



* Preparing Meals: Dietary Aides follow specific procedures to prepare meals, snacks, and beverages for patients. They ensure that food safety and hygiene protocols are strictly adhered to during food preparation.


* Serving Meals: They serve meals to patients, making sure that each dish aligns with the prescribed menu. Timeliness and accuracy are essential when delivering dishes to designated rooms.


* Maintaining Cleanliness: Dietary Aides assist in maintaining a clean and sanitary workplace. This includes setting up and taking down dining areas, washing dishes, and keeping the kitchen equipment and appliances in good condition.


* Inventory Management: They take inventory of kitchen supplies and food items, ensuring that everything is well-stocked and organized.


* Knowledge of Protocols: Dietary Aides stay informed about facility-specific procedures, state regulations, and individual dietary requirements. They collaborate with Dietitians, Chefs, and Doctors to plan menus.

title: HHA Caregiver needed in Trenton NJ

title: Consultant, Aristotle-Confucius Symposium
description:
**ABOUT SDSN**


The UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network (SDSN) has been operating since 2012 under the auspices of the UN Secretary-General. SDSN mobilizes global scientific and technological expertise to promote practical solutions for sustainable development, including the implementation of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and the Paris Climate Agreement. We aim to accelerate joint learning and promote integrated approaches that address the interconnected economic, social, and environmental challenges confronting the world.


SDSN works closely with United Nations agencies, multilateral financing institutions, the private sector, and civil society. It is directed by Professor Jeffrey D. Sachs and operates through offices in New York, Paris, and Kuala Lumpur.

 **ABOUT THE ARISTOTLE-CONFUCIUS SYMPOSIUM**


Our program aims to facilitate dialogue among leaders and scholars from diverse cultural and academic backgrounds. We are honored to collaborate with esteemed institutions of the people’s republic of China and the Hellenic Republic. The UN SDSN, a global network promoting the sustainable development goals under the auspices of un secretary general Antonio Guterres, is the lead convener. The Nishan World Center for Confucius studies and Tsinghua institute for advanced study in humanities and social sciences were the leading hosts of the 2024 symposium.


The 2024 Qufu-Beijing symposium was the third in our series of global meetings bringing together philosophers, policy experts, and leaders in the new digital technologies, to consider the meeting points and divergences of the ancient wisdom traditions, and to consider how we can draw on this vast bounty of knowledge to help us confront challenges such as the environmental crises, challenges of war and peace, and governance over the new cutting-edge technologies.

 **POSITION SUMMARY**


UN SDSN is seeking a talented individual to support the SDSN Senior Manager with the Aristotle-Confucius symposium line of work.

**PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES**

* The consultant will help invite and coordinate with the symposium speakers, assist with the conference volume editorial team's paper selection process.
* Support the review of the manuscript, ensuring accuracy and copyediting.
* Manage the symposium conference email accounts and reply to relevant emails.
* Schedule meetings of the editorial team; take notes at meetings and circulate follow-up action items. Participate in working group meetings.
* Research and writing support for A-C symposium's substantive deliverables.
* Managing and organizing drafts, gaining legal consent for use of images and figures, copyediting, and supporting the design layout of the conference volume.
* Other items as relevant and assigned by the SDSN's Senior Manager.

**QUALIFICATIONS, EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE**

* Professional fluency in English required (written and spoken)
* Master's degree or higher in philosophy, history, humanity or economics is preferred.
* Minimum of 2 years of relevant professional experience in philosophy, history, humanity, or economics.
* Highly organized and detail-oriented
* Exceptional writing, editing, and oral communications skills required
* Experience communicating with and working alongside high-level experts

 **IMPORTANT INFORMATION**


Location: Remote.

  

Contract Length: 12 months.


Salary Range : $16 – 26 per hour, 15 hours per week.


Reports to: Philo Yuqing Wang, Senior Manager

 **SDSN is an Equal Opportunity Employer**


SDSN provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to unlawful considerations of race, color, creed, religion, gender, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, genetic information, military or veteran status, age, and physical or mental disability, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws.

 **APPLICATION PROCESS**


To apply, please submit a cover letter and a CV on HR Partner. Please include links to relevant projects and code samples that you have worked on.

title: Security Dispatcher
description:
**Company:** Kings Security Services Inc.

**Location:** Bronx, NY

**Position Type:** Full-time, Morning (8am-4pm) and Overnight (12am-8am)

**About Us:**  
Kings Security Services Inc. is a leading provider of security solutions, committed to ensuring the safety and protection of our clients and their assets. We pride ourselves on our professionalism, reliability, and dedication to excellence in the security industry.

**Job Description:**  
As a Security Dispatcher at Kings Security Services Inc., you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of our security services during morning or night hours. You will be responsible for dispatching and scheduling security guards or fireguards to various sites in a timely manner, as well as overseeing daily patrol tours and reporting any incidents to management. Additionally, you will manage time approvals for employee payroll, monitor guard attendance, and prevent overtime whenever possible.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Dispatch and schedule guards or fireguards to sites promptly and efficiently.
* Monitor and report on daily patrol tours conducted by security personnel.
* Approve employee hours for payroll on a daily basis.
* Monitor guard attendance at sites for all shifts as required.
* Check the inactive site phone regularly for any incoming communications.
* Take proactive measures to prevent overtime among security personnel.
* Install phones or patrol devices on sites within 48 hours of starting a contract.
* Create client access for all sites and provide passwords to clients.
* Train clients on how to use client access to view patrol activities.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Previous experience in security dispatching or a related field preferred.
* Strong communication and organizational skills.
* Ability to work independently and make quick, informed decisions.
* Proficiency in computer applications and basic technical troubleshooting.
* Flexibility to work overnight shifts and adapt to changing schedules.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $19.38 - $23.34 per hour

Expected hours: 37.5 per week

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* On-the-job training
* Paid time off

Physical Setting:

* Office

Schedule:

* Morning shift
* Overnight shift

Ability to Relocate:

* Bronx, NY 10457: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Director, Operations, Growth, and Special Projects
description:
BloomNet, a division of 1-800-Flowers.com, is seeking an experienced & dynamic project manager to spearhead last mile & growth initiatives. The position will be pivotal in driving complex, strategic projects and coordinating disparate teams toward enterprise-wide goals.
  
  

The Director role requires a unique mix of strategic, operational, technical & influencing skills as the incumbent will work cross-functionally to drive new business projects.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

The role will manage a variety of short-term and long-term business initiatives including but not limited to:
  
  

Leading and managing projects that drive business growth. Running category expansion projects across our existing partnership networks: organizing pilots, with a test & learn lens by introducing new products & services in different target markets
  
  

Developing and implementing strategies to enhance customer satisfaction. Working across the enterprise to introduce and integrate new technologies and innovations. This includes working across the enterprise to improve CX by driving the implementation of new tracking & proof of delivery technologies with our partner florists.
  
  

Identifying and capitalizing on new revenue opportunities and business models. This will include revamping our delivery service provider offering for the partner network to add value to our partner florists, while also generating new revenue streams.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Minimum 7 years of experience managing complex, operational & strategic projects, preferably in a large, multi-faceted organization.
  
  

Proven track record of driving growth initiatives & coordinating large-scale project delivery.
  
  

Exceptional technical, analytical, communication & organizational skills. Experience with data analysis & visualization tools (Excel,Tableau,SAS,Powerpoint).
  
  

Strong leadership skills with the ability to influence & engage teams without direct authority.
  
  

Demonstrated ability to act as organizational glue, coordinating and aligning efforts across multiple teams and departments.
  
  

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent.
  
  

The expected salary for this position is $135,000 - $165,000. The actual compensation will be determined by experience and other factors permitted by the law.
  
  

* Must be able to work on-site in our Jericho, Long Island HQ 4 to 5x per week

title: After School Program Supervisor
description:
This position requires good administrative, organizational, and computer skills in order to coordinate all aspects of operation for our Create Success educational programs, which include After school, Summer program, and College Bound.

Candidate should have experience working with school-age children in afterschool or related programs and be able to maintain the requirements to meet with the SACC Child Care License.

Candidate will work directly under the Executive Director, must be able to work independently and as a team player, be able to interact with COC partners, parents, tutors, and staff in order to achieve the highest quality environment.

**Job Description - Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:**

* Maintain all up to date requirements and paperwork for the SACC Child Care License.
* Manage student recruitment, application and enrollment process.
* Manage tutor recruitment application and hiring process.
* Maintain all paperwork for tutors, supervisors and students.
* Collect, track, and record participant fees and attendance.
* Record and maintain all outcome data and create reports
* Prepare and inventory all program materials.
* Prepare tutor training, parent meetings, and special events.
* Establish and maintain relationships with teachers and faculty in local schools.
* Establish and maintain communication with parents.
* Directly oversee and supervise tutors, holding them accountable for their assignments, and obtaining necessary reports from them.
* Keep a calendar of time and task items for the year.

Full time or Part time, depending on the candidate's qualifications and availability.

*Hours will depend on full time or part time hire.*

**Part-time Minimum expected Days and Hours are:** 

* School Year (September-June): Monday - Friday 3pm-6pm.
* Summer (July - August): Monday-Friday, 9am -3pm.

**Full-time expected Days and Hours are:** 

* School Year (September-June): Monday-Friday, 3pm-6pm.
* Summer (July-August): Monday-Friday 9am-3pm.

**Starting salary** 

* $20-$25 Per hour depending on credentials, experience and skills.
* *Opportunity for increase of salary, and growth in the organization.*

**Requirements:**

* Obtain CPR & First Aid certification.
* Efficient in Microsoft Word and Excel
* Good computer and database skills.
* Knowledge of conversational Spanish is helpful but not mandatory.

**\\*Candidates that meet one of the following categories of criteria will be most considered for this position:**

1.) Bachelor's or Associate’s degree in Education, Early Childhood, Child Development, Psychology, or a related field. And One year teaching or supervisory experience in a school, child day care center, family or group family day care home or other early childhood program

OR

2.)New York State Children's Program Administrator Credential and one year teaching or supervisory experience

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 30 per week

Schedule:

* Afternoon shift
* After school
* Monday to Friday

title: LPN
description:
**OVERVIEW:**  

Responsible for the overall operation and optimal quality of care for the residents on the assigned unit. Follows all health, sanitary and infection control policies and maintains established standards of practice set forth by the facility's administration and the Nursing Policies and Procedures. As an LPN you will be responsible for providing residents assistance with ADLs and in the administration of their medications while overseeing staff. Adhering to the instructions of Nurse Management, you will perform your duties in accordance with all company policies and procedures, while providing resident care services with kindness and compassion to the residents.
  
  

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

Holds daily shift report with nursing assistants assigned to the unit prior to the start of the shift. Reviews written daily assignments for each resident on assigned unit. Assures assignments are completed before the end of the shift
  
Makes rounds on assigned residents at least once every two hours
  
Administers medication and treatments according to the physician's orders. Assumes responsibility for ordering medications
  
Collaborates with Care Plan Coordinator to develop and maintain nursing care plans and update these plans on a monthly basis or more often if the resident's condition changes
  
Assists the attending physician with rounds and special procedures as needed
  
Transcribes, documents and implements physician's orders
  
Contacts the resident's physician and family to notify them of a change in the resident's condition or accident/incident; also notifies the supervisor covering
  
Assumes independent responsibility for yearly written evaluations of nursing assistants and documents accurately their strengths, weaknesses and the steps taken to improve their performance. Such evaluations become part of the nursing assistants’ permanent records and shall be used as the basis to determine the continued employment of nursing assistants, promotional opportunities and the amount of any wage increases granted
  
Assumes independent responsibility for documenting disciplinary concerns for nursing assistants on designated shifts, including reprimands, oral and written warnings, and recommending the suspension or discharge of an employee
  
Assumes independent responsibility for completing required routine documentation and auditing as required
  
Participates in the hiring, interviewing and orientation of nursing assistants
  
Assist in the Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement (QAPI) process
  
  

**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

**EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE:**  

Practical Nurse licensed in the State of employment
  
Minimum one year of education or experience in geriatric nursing or rehabilitation preferred
  
Knowledge of nursing theory and practice, including the administration of medications
  
Ability to read, write and comprehend English
  
CPR certified
  
  

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.
  
  

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**  

This job operates in a health care setting. This role requires regular walking to various locations around the care center.
  
Incumbent may be exposed to virus, disease and infection from patients and specimens in working environment.
  
Incumbent may be required to work extended periods of time at a video display terminal.
  
Incumbent may experience traumatic situations, including psychiatric, and deceased patients.
  
  

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
  
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus
  
This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling and climbing all day.
  
The employee must frequently lift or move objects and patients weighing over 50 pounds.
  
  

**TRAVEL:**  

No travel is expected for this position

title: Certified Home Health Aide
description:
**1000 Sign On Bonus!!!!**



Great new Career Opportunity in Hospice!

  



Now Hiring - **Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA)**



This **Certified Home Health Aide** will be responsible for, but not limited to:



* Provides or assists in ADL activities; personal hygiene, grooming, mouth, skin care and nails.


* Provides assistance in toileting; positioning and transfer activities, frequent turning and positioning of a bed bound resident/patient.


* Assists with the prescribed exercise and ROM activities which the resident/patient and Hospice aide have been taught by the Hospice Nurse.


* Assists with light housekeeping of individual's personal unit or room, including changing of bed linen, if needed and patient laundry.


* Feeds and assists with meals.


* Obtains temperature, pulse and respirations as supervised by the Hospice Nurse.


* Reports any changes in resident's/patient's condition to the Hospice Nurse and, if in a facility, to the facility nurse and documents the information on the Home Health Aide Certification of House form, including the date and time of the report and the person receiving the information.


* Assists or reminds the patient to take medication, in compliance with regulations of appropriate regulatory and accrediting bodies.

EEO/AA/M/F/DV

title: Day Hab Counselor (Bronx)
description:
**Salary:** $17.26 per hour plus full benefits!

  

**Schedule:** Monday to Friday 8:00am-4:30pm


**Location: Bronx, NY**



You will be assisting individuals with Autism to acquire, retain or improve their socialization, communication, and travel skills through recreational activities and community outings.



Once those residing in our communities have aged out of school-based programs, our Day Services continue to reinforce the everyday skills necessary to successfully function in the world around us. We focus strongly on ensuring all program participants spend time in their local communities learning life skills, functional academics, and experiencing volunteerism along with a variety of sports and recreational activities.

  


This is a great position to grow in - we provide free portable training and certifications!


**Requirements:**

  

* **Valid Driver's License and High School Diploma/GED.**
* Must be able to attend orientation before starting official shift. This paid training is located at our main office in the Bronx.
* Must be able to submit a PPD test by the time of hire.
* Comfortable driving a 15-passenger van - you will be road tested prior to starting.
* Must attend additional trainings within 6 months of hired (CPR, SCIP, AMAP).
* Comfortable with daily use of technology (computer, email, phone, typing etc).
* Effective verbal and written communication.


**Benefits:**

  

* 17 days of PTO in your first year
* 4 Personal Days
* 10 Agency Paid Holidays
* Low Cost Medical Insurance, Dental, Vision Coverage, & Life Insurance
* 403 B Retirement Plans (2% match)
* Professional Development
* Employee Discount Programs


*Special Citizens Futures Unlimited, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO).*

title: Personal Injury Litigation Paralegal
Merger Opportunity For Attorneys
Per Diem Medical Assistant $27 per hour
description:
At Doral Health & Wellness, we are proud of our commitment to the East New York community to provide integrated interdisciplinary health services in an innovative medical facility dedicated to the health and well-being of our patients. We partner with insurance companies, managed care organizations and hospitals in the area in order to treat our patients with the highest level of care and respect.



We are seeking an Administrative Medical Assistant who will oversee and coordinate the care of patients within our Telehealth department. This will primarily entail periodic telephonic outreach calls to each patient to address any urgent needs, confirm medication adherence, assuring alignment across the patient's entire care continuum, and assess various aspects of overall health.


**Medical Assistant Job Responsibilities:**


* Verifies patient information by interviewing patient, recording medical history, and confirming the purpose of the visit.
* Prepares patients for examination by performing preliminary physical tests; taking blood pressure, weight, and temperature; and reporting patient history summary.
* Saves doctors’ time by helping preparing patient prior to exam
* Secures patient information and maintains patient confidence by completing and safeguarding medical records; completing diagnostic coding and procedure coding; and keeping patient information confidential.
* Counsel patients by transmitting physician’s orders and questions about surgery.
* Serves and protects the practice by adhering to professional standards; facility policies and procedures; and federal, state, and local requirements.
* Enhances practice reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests, and exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.


**Medical Assistant Qualifications/Skills:**


* Supply management
* Verbal communication
* Infection control
* Creating a safe, effective environment
* Organization
* Scheduling
* Professionalism
* Customer focus
* Confidentiality
* Bedside manner
* Medical teamwork


**Education, Experience, and Licensing Requirements:**


* Certified Clinical Medical Assistant (CCMA)
* Bachelor’s degree preferred
* 1+ years in a medical office
* Experience with EMR (electronic medical records), medical terminology
* Previous experience in specific medical field preferred

title: Recreation Aide *Weekends*
description:

Support Certified Nursing Assistants, Recreation in providing assistance with meals, activities of daily living, recreation programs, diversional activities to individuals with diagnosis of Alzheimer’s, dementia, other cognitive impairments and behaviors. Maintain safety, encourage independence and help meet care plan goals.
